title: R-Ladies Belgrade: Networking and Social
description:
Dobro doÅ¡li na prvi R-Ladies Belgrade MeetUp!

RazgovaraÄ‡emo o tome Å¡ta to R nudi i Äini jedinstveno prikladnim za obavljanje nauke o podacima, bolje znane kao Data Science (DS). RazmotriÄ‡emo alate potrebne za rad na tipiÄnom DS projektu, koje Ä‡emo ilustrovati na malom primeru. RazmeniÄ‡emo razmisljanja o tome Å¡ta podrazumevamo pod terminom Data Science i najboljim naÄinima komuniciranja rezultata analiza s ciljanom publikom.

Voleli bismo da dodjete i da nam se pridruÅ¾ite u diskusijama i razmeni iskustava u radu na Vasim svakodnevnim DS projektima.

Ne morate biti korisnik R-a, niti njegov struÄnjak da bi ste se pridruÅ¾iti naÅ¡im diskusijama. Potrebno je samo da imate interesovanje za uÄenje, rad i upoznavanjem sa DS projektima i R-om.

title: Meetup with RStudio's Hadley Wickham
description:
Hello R-Ladies Belgrade community!

Join us for an evening with Hadley Wickham and fellow R enthusiasts.

We are excited to host Hadley Wickham at our meetup! Hadley is a Chief Data Scientist at RStudio, a member of the R Foundation, and Adjunct Professor of statistics at the University of Auckland, Stanford University and Rice University.

Hadley is best known for propagating tidy data approach and developing the tidyverse R package(s) that make data science easier, faster and more intuitive. Hadley is a great advocate of diversity within the R community.

We are looking forward to seeing you allâ€¦

title: R for Data Science - Book Club #1
description:
Drage R Å¾ene,

SledeÄ‡e srede kreÄ‡e prolaÅ¾enje kroz R for Data Science knjigu kojoj moÅ¾ete pristupiti ovde: http://r4ds.had.co.nz/. Dragana PavloviÄ‡ Ä‡e sa nama proÄ‡i kroz:

- Poglavlje 3: Transformisanje pomoÄ‡u paketa dplyr
- Poglavlje 8: UvoÅ¾enje podataka pomoÄ‡u paketa readr
- Upisivanje u datoteku
- Drugi tipovi podataka
- Poglavlje 9: SreÄ‘ivanje podataka pomoÄ‡u paketa tidyr

Ideja je da same proÄ‘emo kroz ova poglavlja, pa da na meetup doÄ‘emo i sa dilemama, predlozima i pitanjima.

title: R for Data Science: Study group intro
description:
Drage R Ladies,

Lepe vesti: Hadley Wickham, chief scientist u RStudio i profesor statistike, Ä‡e nam drÅ¾ati predavanje 18. septembra. ViÅ¡e o Hadley-u i njegovom radu moÅ¾ete proÄitati ovde: http://hadley.nz/.

Zbog toga smo odluÄile da je vreme da pokrenemo study group za prolaÅ¾enje kroz njegovu knjigu R for Data Science, koja vam je dostupna ovde: http://r4ds.had.co.nz/.

Ideja je da organizujemo nedeljna okupljanja gde Ä‡emo prolaziti kroz razliÄita poglavlja knjige, razmenjivati iskustva, reÅ¡avati nedoumice, itd. Ovi meetupi Ä‡e biti primarno posveÄ‡eni vama koje tek poÄinjete da ulazite u R, ali su naravno otvoreni za sve.

S obzirom da je ovo jako "short notice" obaveÅ¡tenje za meetup, u sredu Ä‡emo imati samo uvod u knjigu, koji Ä‡e pripremiti Radmila VeliÄkoviÄ‡, kao i dogovor o tome kako biste Å¾elele da sastajanje study group teÄe.

Ukoliko ne moÅ¾ete da stignete u sredu, a zainteresovane ste da se ukljuÄite u study group - piÅ¡ite mi pa Ä‡emo iskombinovati slack i druge kanale komunikacije da uzmemo u obzir vaÅ¡e komentare :)

Happy Monday to us all,

Tatjana, Radmila i Katarina

title: R Ladies Belgrade #3: R&I predavanje + R Markdown radionica
description:
Ovog puta meetup poÄinjemo sa predavanjem profesorke Nadice MiljkoviÄ‡, pod nazivom "R & I". Nadica Ä‡e priÄati o tome kako se upoznala sa R-om, o svim prednostima rada u R-u, kao i kako je promenio naÄin njenog rada.

Nakon toga, Tatjana Ä‡e odrÅ¾ati radionicu o kreiranju izveÅ¡taja koji se mogu reprodukovati koristeÄ‡i R Markdown. *R Markdown dokumenti mogu se reprodukovati u potpunosti i podrÅ¾avaju gotovo sve statiÄke i dinamiÄke output formate. Jedan R Markdown moÅ¾e se koristiti za Äuvanje i izvoÄ‘enje koda, kao i za generisanje visoko kvalitetnih izveÅ¡taja koji se mogu deliti sa publikom.* Ovakve radionice je Tatjana veÄ‡ drÅ¾ala u ManÄesteru i kroz svoje materijale brzo uvodi uÄesnice u praktiÄnu primenu R Markdowna.

Na kraju meetupa, ostavljamo prostor za druÅ¾enje i razmenu iskustava. Grab a sticker & hang around! :)

PredavaÄice:
Dr Nadica MiljkoviÄ‡ je zavrÅ¡ila osnovne, master i doktorske studije na ETF-u, a trenutno je docent na istom fakultetu. Bavi se biomedicinskim inÅ¾enjerstvom sa akcentom na merenja i analizu biosignala. Studentima master studija predaje R na predmetu Tehnike obrade biomedicinskih signala TOBS.

Dr Tatjana KecojeviÄ‡ je dugogodiÅ¡nja R programerka sa doktoratom iz statistike na Univerzitetu u ManÄesteru. Osnovala je RLadies-Manchester grupe i DataTeka za obuku u R-u. Njeno interesovanje je u oblasti statistiÄkog modeliranja, statistiÄkog raÄunarstva, statistiÄkog kompjuterskog obrazovanja i svega Å¡to je vezano za #rstats.

Vidimo se uskoro :)

title: R Ladies Belgrade #2: Manipulacija podacima i vizualizacija
description:
Drugi R ladies meetup u Beogradu!

Dodjite sa svojim laptopom sa R (https://cran.r-project.org/) i RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download) instaliranim.

Prvih sat vremena oÄekujte radionicu tokom koje Ä‡e Tatjana (https://tanjakec.github.io) priÄati o eksplanatornoj analizi podataka. UpoznaÄ‡ete se sa alatkama za manipulaciju i vizualizaciju podataka kao Å¡to su dplyr i ggplot2.

Ako neka od vas Å¾eli da odrÅ¾i kratku prezentaciju ili takozvani "lightning talk" od 5-10min o interesantnom projektu za koji ste koristile R ili bi jednostavno Å¾elela da predstavi svoj R kod ili R paket, javite nam se da bismo vas ukljuÄile u program! KonaÄni program Ä‡emo objaviti nekoliko dana pred meetup.

-------------------------

Ne morate biti korisnica R-a da biste se pridruÅ¾ile meetup-u sve dok ste zainteresovane da ga nauÄite i saznate viÅ¡e o nauci o podacima (eng. data science) i R-u.

title: H2O R machine learning tutorial by Erin LeDell
description:
Hello R-Ladies Belgrade community!

Join us for an evening with Erin LeDell a member of R-Ladies Global Leadership team and Chief Machine Learning Scientist at H2O.ai. Erin will be a keynote speaker at this yearâ€™s Data Science Conference and will deliver an H20 R machine learning tutorial to R-Ladies Belgrade.

We are very excited to host Erin at our meetup! As many of you will know H2O.ai, is the company that produces the open source, distributed machine learning platform, H2O. Before joining H2O.ai, Erin was the Principal Data Scientist at two AI startups, the founder of DataScientific, Inc. and a software engineer at a large consulting firm.

Erin is well known within R community for democratising Machine Learning with H2O and developing a number of R packages. She is a great advocate of diversity within the DS, ML and R communities.

Agenda:
â€¢ 5:30pm -- Doors open and refreshments
â€¢ 6:00pm -- Welcome to all R-Ladies Belgrade: Introduction, Announcements
â€¢ 6:05pm -- H2O R machine learning tutorial by Erin LeDell
â€¢ 7:00pm -- Hang around: drinks, pizza and a chance to chat
â€¢ 7:45pm -- End

We would love you to come and join us, bring a friend or two and share your thoughts and experiences when working on your every-day DS projects.

You donâ€™t have to be an R user to come and join our discussion, as long as you have interest in learning, doing and getting to know more about data science and R.

All welcome!

We are looking forward to seeing you allâ€¦

Thanks to Startit (https://startit.rs/) and Data Science Serbia (http://www.datascience.rs/) for providing the venue and making this event possible.

title: R u analitici semantiÄkog veba: sluÄaj Wikidata; IzlagaÄ: Dr G. S. MilovanoviÄ‡
description:
Drage R-Ladies, DoÅ¡ao je kraj sezone odmora i vreme je za nove akcije ğŸ’ª

ImaÄ‡emo Äast i zadovoljstvo da novu sezonu zapoÄnemo izlaganjem Dr Gorana S. MilanoviÄ‡a, dugogodiÅ¡njim korisnikom R-a i Data Scientis-om ogromnog znanja i iskustva koje Ä‡e nesebiÄno podeliti sa nama.

Ako niste videle R-u akciji u pravom smislu te reÄi, dodjite da se prikljuÄite Goranovom izlaganju i kasnijoj diskusiji.

S nestrpljenjem oÄekujemo naÅ¡e okupljanje ğŸ¤—

~~~~~~~

R u analitici semantiÄkog veba: sluÄaj Wikidata

Tokom meetup-a Ä‡u predstaviti bazu znanja, semantiÄki veb sistem Wikidata, koji pruÅ¾a podrÅ¡ku za struktuirane podatke slobodnoj enciklopediji Wikipedia i drugim projektima Wikimedia fondacije. PokazaÄ‡u nekoliko naÄina za pristup podacima sa Wikidata iz programskog jezika R, ukljuÄujuÄ‡i i lako upotrebljiv paket {WikidataR}. PredstaviÄ‡u nekoliko Big Data analitiÄkih sistema razvijenih u R koji kroz maÅ¡insko uÄenje (topic models - LDA, t-SNE) i vizuelizacije podataka i rezultata (rBokeh, plotly, visNetwork, igraph, dygraphs, Shiny) omoguÄ‡avaju praÄ‡enje semantiÄke strukture Wikidata. TrudiÄ‡u se, ipak, da centralna nit mog izlaganja ne bude samo prezentacija razliÄitih sistema i reÅ¡enja, veÄ‡ suoÄavanje sa praktiÄnim, realnim problemima u Big Data analizama, od kojih - daÄ‡u primere - neke efikasnije reÅ¡avamo u R (sa dovoljno dobrom hardverskom podrÅ¡kom, naravno) nego u specijalizovanim Big Data sistemima (poput Spark, koji koristim praktiÄno samo u ETL fazama). Voleo bih da vam poklonim neke trikove u izraÄunavanju ogromnih kontingencijskih tabela i metrika u R koji vam mogu posluÅ¾iti za razvoj igraÄaka poput popularnih recommender systems. KonaÄno, ako mi vreme dopusti, osvrnuo bih se na tipiÄno savremeno obrazovanje u R za Data Science i zaÅ¡to smatram da na kraju dana bolje pliva onaj koji je prvo zaista postao R programer, a onda nauÄio {tidyverse} - koji veoma volim i koristim svakodnevno. BiÄ‡e i Rmarkdown notebook za sve koji bi voleli da poÄnu da uÄe o pristupu Wikidata iz R. Na kraju, cilj mi je da vam pokaÅ¾em koliko je svet koji nastanjujemo u Data Science izuzetno zabavan, interesantan i dubok, i zaÅ¡to ne treba da odustanete od namere da se u njemu profesionalno nastanite!

~~~~~~~

Dr Goran S. MilovanoviÄ‡ je studirao matematiku, filozofiju, i psihologiju, na Univerzitetu u Beogradu i NYU (SAD), i stekao formalno obrazovanje u eksperimentalnoj i teorijskoj psihologiji u oblasti kognitivnih nauka. Programer je od 80-ih godina i 8-bitnih maÅ¡ina sa 64K RAM memorije. Njegov put u Data Science zapoÄeo je prouÄavanjem probabilistiÄkih modela ljudskih kognitivnih funkcija (kategorizacija i uÄenje koncepata, semantiÄka memorija, kauzalna indukcija, odluÄivanje u uslovima rizika i neizvesnosti) i modeliranjem podataka dobijenih bihejvioralnim eksperimenatima. Danas radi u programskim jezicima R i Python, uz podrÅ¡ku raznih drugih tehnologija i standarda (Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, SPARQL, SQL, XML, JSON i drugih). Programski jezik R je njegova pasija i specijalnost. Od 2017. radi kao Data Scientist za projekte Wikidata i Wiktionary sa Wikimedia Deutschland, gde koristi R u analizi nekih od najveÄ‡ih i najsloÅ¾enijih skupova otvorenih podataka danas uopÅ¡te dostupnih. Vlasnik je konsultantske firme DataKolektiv.

title: Women in DS Conference

title: Podaci o zagaÄ‘enju vazduha: Kako ih prikupljamo, a kako vizualizujemo?
description:
Prvi R Ladies meetup ove godine odrÅ¾aÄ‡e se na temu podataka o zagaÄ‘enju vazduha. Kao i svake prethodne zime, Beograd je i sada na listi najzagaÄ‘enijih gradova.

Prvi deo meetupa Ä‡e se fokusirati na vizualizaciju podataka o zagaÄ‘anju vazduha u R-u, prezentaciju Ä‡e odrÅ¾ati Jovana SaviÄ‡ i Katarina Kosmina. Diskusija se odrÅ¾ava u okviru inicijative â€Vidljivi podaci za nevidljivi vazduhâ€œ, koji sprovodi Beogradska otvorena Å¡kola u saradnji sa Internet druÅ¡tvom Srbije i IoT kompanijom AllThingsTalk.

Meetup Ä‡e se odrÅ¾ati u Startit Centru Beograd, Savska 5, 30. januara (Äetvrtak) od 18-20h. Prijava preko Startita: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfpOXiwBRMqnd5WVzhauBGXeDPhLY68_HavAdt7UpX9KeknqA/viewform.

Inicijativa je podrÅ¾ana od strane projekta â€œOtvoreni podaci â€“ otvorene moguÄ‡nostiâ€, koji sprovode Kancelarija za informacione tehnologije i elektronsku upravu i Program Ujedinjenih nacija za razvoj, uz podrÅ¡ku Svetske banke i Fonda za dobru upravu Ujedinjenog Kraljevstva.

title: Introduce yourself online with blogdown & Hugo ApÃ©ro
description:
Dragi svi,
jos jedna super radionica sjajne Alison Hill je zakazana za 26. maj i organizuju je divne R-Ladies Tunis. Svi detalji su ovde:

We are delighted to invite you to our next meetup. We will be organizing a new workshop about Using blogdown & Hugo ApÃ©ro to create your personal website.

Date/Time: Wednesday, May 26th, 2021 from 7 PM to 9 PM (GMT+1)
Place: Zoom

â–¶ï¸ Invited trainer: Dr. Alison Hill

â–¶ï¸ About Dr. Alison Hill :
Alison Hill is a data scientist, behavioral scientist, and an award-winning educator. Currently, Dr. Hill works to make data science communication easier and more delightful using RStudioâ€™s open-source toolchain. Previously, Alison was an Associate Professor of Pediatrics at Oregon Health & Science University. Her research focused on health-related applications of Natural Language Processing-based methods, and was funded by the National Institutes of Health, the Oregon Clinical and Translational Research Institute, and Autism Speaks. She has written numerous scientific publications on autism and neurodevelopmental disorders and has presented research at over 25 international conferences. Alison has also taught statistics and data science for over 10 years; most recently, she has led advanced workshops on data science communication and machine learning at rstudio::conf, R / Medicine, and R in Pharma. She is also an international keynote speaker (https://alison.rbind.io/talks), co-developer of the palmerpenguins (https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/), distill (https://rstudio.github.io/distill/), and blogdown (https://pkgs.rstudio.com/blogdown) R packages, and co-author of the book blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown (https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/).

â–¶ï¸ About the workshop:
â€œYou should have a website!â€ You may have heard this one before, or even said it yourself. In this workshop, youâ€™ll learn how to build and customize a website from the comfort of the RStudio IDE with R Markdown. We'll use the blogdown package and the Hugo ApÃ©ro theme to build and deploy a personal website. Weâ€™ll cover basic website care and feeding like using R Markdown to create content, how to use GitHub for version control and Netlify for publishing, and how to use the latest upgrades to the blogdown R package to keep your site up and running.

â–¶ï¸ Prerequisites

You'll get the most out of this workshop if you do the pre-work ahead of time. Please follow the instructions here: https://iyo-rstudio-global.netlify.app/collection/prework/.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form ğŸ‘‰ https://tinyurl.com/dre27d3k

We will send you the zoom link a few hours before the training session. Please check out your email later.

We look forward to welcoming you!

title: [R Lille] My Journey To Transparency And Reproducibility
description:
Dragi svi, evo joÅ¡ jednog interesantnog predavanja koje organizuju kolege iz R Lil iz Francuske svi detalji su ovde:

Details

[Abstract]
In this talk, I (MickaÃ«l Canouil, https://m.canouil.fr) will chronicle my journey towards a more transparent and reproducible work environment. I will talk about the changes and improvements that I have implemented in my team, detailing the transition of infrastructure used when I arrived to an infrastructure using Docker and and the {renv} R package.

[Bio]
I am a biostatistician (Ph.D.) and the head of a small team within a research laboratory, working primarily on the genetics of diabetes and obesity.
I have developed a few R packages, and although some are not very useful, they are most definitely entertaining (i.e., https://github.com/mcanouil/ggpacman/).
I also enjoy watching movies and playing with R (https://m.canouil.fr/imdb_ratings/).

[About]
This event (in English) is organised by the R Lille user group (Lille, France).
https://www.meetup.com/R-Lille/events/277031496/

title: Barcelona R User Group meetup (online) + rstudio::global(2021) preview
description:
Dragi svi, evo jos jednog interesantnog dogadjaja koji organizuje Barcelona R.

Å½elimo vam sreÄ‡ne praznike!!! :)

Details:

Barcelona R User Group - https://www.barcelonar.org/ - is happy to announce the next online meetup event and the first in 2021 with an exciting collaboration with the folks at RStudio!

See the agenda below (times in UTC):

6:15 - 6:30 - Set up (systems check) and virtual hellos
6:30 - 7:30 - Workshop*: Introduction to Machine Learning - by Nicolas Attalides
7:30 - 8:00 - "Big pharmacy data: Using R to help turn data over to the public" - by Andrew Ba Tran - (rstudio::global pre-recorded presentation followed by live Q & A session with Andrew)
8:00 - 8:15 - rstudio::global(2021) preview and Q & A - by Curtis Kephart
8:15 - 8:30: Online socialising

*The workshop is designed to be hands-on so if you would like to participate then please join us with your laptop and be ready to code!

Big pharmacy data: Using R to help turn data over to the public
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This talk will go over how The Washington Post used R to analyze hundreds of gigs of data from the DEA as part of its investigation into the opioid epidemic.
* Dealing with big data in R with doparallel
* Exploratory visualizations and mapping with various packages like RLeaflet and geofacet
* Making an API with janitor for easier data distribution
* Making an R package on top of the API for documentation and vignettes
* Inspiring the creation of a Python library on top of the API to access ARCOS data
* Updating the package so that all parts of the data can be used that will hopefully inspire others to go further than the Post
> Andrew Ba Tran <- is a Data Reporter at The Washington Post

rstudio::global(2021) is a free, virtual event on all things R & RStudio.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It's hosted over 24-hours â€“ giving people at different timezones a number of options to conveniently engage â€“ with a number of talks and community-engagement events we hope you'll enjoy. It starts on 21st January 2021 @ 4:00 PM GMT.
Learn more about rstudio::global(2021) and register at global.rstudio.com
> Curtis Kephart <- is an Economist and Community Organizer at RStudio

https://www.meetup.com/BarcelonaR/events/275252135/

title: Data Hangout
description:
Data science can be intimidating. Especially so, when you are first embarking on your data adventure. Which tool to learn â€“ R or Python? What statistical methods to learn? What are typical data problems you need to be familiar with? What techniques to focus on? Which statistical method is applicable to my problem? These are some of the many questions you will begin to answer as you begin your journey.

**Data Hangout** is open access series of meetup workshops and discussions for people already working with data, or are just simply curious about what all the fuss is about. Data Hangout provides space for meaningful conversations or informal chats for data practitioners or those who are aspiring to be. Our motivation is to put ideas into action through the delivery of hands-on workshops.

Irrespective of whether youâ€™re already a data scientist or data enthusiast, our **Data Hangouts** are here to inform, motivate and equip you to use data as part of your everyday language. In turn, this will empower you to make data more integral to your daily working practices and be more prolific, regardless of your educational background and profession.

Together we share learning from both successful and challenging experiences to assemble and to deepen our collective data science knowledge. We build positive and active learning communities of data specialists with a diverse range of experiences and perspectives.
We discuss the skills and tools needed to get to grips with typical data science projects, illustrated by addressing the tasks required in formulating small case studies. We exchange ideas on how we consider data exploration and statistical modelling and the best ways of communicating the results with the target audience.

We do this by working through the open access material [DiSCDOWN](https://discdown.org), an online learning material platform developed at the [UniversitÃ¤t Innsbruck](https://www.uibk.ac.at/en/) using [R](https://www.r-project.org) and [Python](https://www.python.org).

In this month's **Data Hangout** we'll reserve 1st 45 minutes 17:00-17:45 for an '**R Clinic for beginners**' to assist with learning R syntax and troubleshooting some general programming questions. We will follow up our meeting with [DiSCDOWN](https://discdown.org) **workshop** 17:50:19:00 and a '**Presentation**' by [Nikola Panajotov](https://www.linkedin.com/in/npanajotov/) 19:00-19:30.

**The Schedule:**

* **16:50** Doors open and refreshments
* **17:00** **R Clinic for beginners**
* **17:45** Welcome break to all
* **17:50** **DiscDown:: Data Analytics:** Chapter 3 and maybe 4
* **19:00** **Presentation**: **Betting shops constellations** by [Nikola Panajotov](https://www.linkedin.com/in/npanajotov/)
How much betting shops in Belgrade are breaking the â€œGames of Chance Law?"
Using open data and by creating effective visualisation [Nikola](https://www.linkedin.com/in/npanajotov/) will show us are there betting shops in Belgrade that are breaking the law of being located within the minimum distance from the educational institutions required by the Serbian law.
Hereâ€™s a teaser: [https://maariaah.github.io/betting-shops-constellations/](https://maariaah.github.io/betting-shops-constellations/)
* **19:30** **Hang around**: a chance to chat
* **20:00** **The End**

We would love you to come and join us, bring a friend or two and share your thoughts and experiences when working on your every-day DS projects.

All welcome! We are looking forward to seeing youâ€¦

ps. please make sure you have read the code of conduct from our website: [https://sisteranalyst.org/coc](https://sisteranalyst.org/coc)

Thanks to [ICT HUB](https://www.icthub.rs/) for providing the venue and making this event possible.

title: Data Hangout
description:
## Details

Data science can be intimidating. Especially so, when you are first embarking on your data adventure. Which tool to learn â€“ R or Python? What statistical methods to learn? What are typical data problems you need to be familiar with? What techniques to focus on? Which statistical method is applicable to my problem? These are some of the many questions you will begin to answer as you begin your journey.

**Data Hangout** is open access series of meetup workshops and discussions, organised by [SisterAnalyst](https://www.meetup.com/sister-analyst/), for people already working with data or are just simply curious about what all the fuss is about. Data Hangout provides space for meaningful conversations or informal chats for data practitioners or those who are aspiring to be. Our motivation is to put ideas into action through the delivery of hands-on workshops.

Irrespective of whether youâ€™re already a data scientist or data enthusiast, our Data Hangouts are here to inform, motivate and equip you to use data as part of your everyday language. In turn, this will empower you to make data more integral to your daily working practices and be more prolific, regardless of your educational background and profession. Together we share learning from both successful and challenging experiences to assemble and to deepen our collective data science knowledge. We build positive and active learning communities of data specialists with a diverse range of experiences and perspectives.
We discuss the skills and tools needed to get to grips with typical data science projects, illustrated by addressing the tasks required in formulating small case studies. We exchange ideas on how we consider data exploration and statistical modelling and the best ways of communicating the results with the target audience.

We do this by working through the open access material [DiSCDOWN](https://discdown.org/) (discdown.org), an online learning material platform developed by at the [UniversitÃ¤t Innsbruck](https://www.uibk.ac.at/en/) using **R** and **Python**.

**In this month's workshop we will:**
\- get to know each other
\- get familiar with DiSCDOWN learning material
\- set up working environment on your computers \(make sure you can run R and Python\)
\- work though DiSCDOWN::Data Analysis::Chapter 3: Data handling

You donâ€™t have to be a data science expert to come and join our discussions, as long as you have interest in learning, doing and getting to know more about data science and its wider potential. We warmly appreciate your contribution in sharing your knowledge and experiences.

**Agenda:**
â€¢ 5:30pm -- Doors open and refreshments
â€¢ 6:00pm -- Welcome to Data Hangout: Introduction, Announcements
â€¢ 6:05pm -- Workshop and Discussion: Why R and Python? Why DiscDown? Data handling
â€¢ 7:30pm -- Hang around: a chance to chat
â€¢ 8:00pm â€“ The End

We would love you to come and join us, bring a friend or two and share your thoughts and experiences when working on your every-day DS projects.

All welcome!

ps. please make sure you have read the code of conduct from our website: https://sisteranalyst.org/coc

Thanks to [ICT HUB](https://www.icthub.rs/) for providing the venue and making this event possible.

title: Radionica: Izazov Otvorenih Podataka kroz R
description:
Dogadjaj realizuje [Sister Analyst](https://sisteranalyst.org/) uz pomoÄ‡ [Open Data Hub](https://hub.data.gov.rs/en/home/)-a i poziva vas da se pridruÅ¾ite.

Dogadjaj je besplatan, al zahteva da se registrujete. ViÅ¡e informacija moÅ¾ete pronaÄ‡i na sledeÄ‡em linku:

https://tanjakec.github.io/ODHBG/

*Kratak opis:*
UÄesnici radionice cÌe se upoznati sa razliÄitim naÄinima pristupa otvorenim podacima i mocÌi cÌe da se ukljuÄe u neophodne korake pripreme podataka za analizu. BicÌe im data prilika da se upoznaju sa tipiÄnim alatima koji se koriste u procesima analize podataka. Sve ovo cÌe biti ilustrovano kroz primer rada sa podacima o kvalitetu vazduha, koji je u fokusu mnoguh diskusija graÄ‘ana Srbije. UÄesnici cÌe takoÄ‘e mocÌi da nauÄe kako da saopÅ¡te rezultate na transparentan i reproduciabilan naÄin kreiranjem dinamiÄkih dokumenata. Pored toga, svi uÄesnici Ä‡e biti upuÄ‡eni na platformu [Open Data Challenge](https://www.r-project.org/) gde mogu naÄ‡i materijal uz pomoÄ‡ koga mogu da nauÄe kako da kreiraju besplatan hosting web stranica svojih analitiÄkih narativa i izveÅ¡taja koristeÄ‡i `Netlify i RMarkdown`.

title: BlgrdR: Make you code more shareable, reusable and reproducible with R packages
description:
Dear R ladies, BelgradeR colleagues are organizing online Meetup on Tuesday.

Details and link:

**Wrap it up: Make you code more shareable, reusable and reproducible with R packages**
**Speaker: Mike Page**
**N.B.** This is an **online event**.
**Abstract**
R packages are the fundamental unit of reproducible R code. In this talk, Mike is going to make a case that everybody writing R code should be thinking about abstracting their work into this format, from stand-alone analyses to Shiny apps. The talk will be grounded in real-world examples from data science work performed at the British Red Cross, discussing the benefits and costs of approaching everything as an R package. The talk will conclude with some concrete advice on how to improve your workflow using an R package structure.
**Bio**
Mike Page is a data scientist on the Strategic Insight and Foresight team at the British Red Cross. Here, he helps to develop a suite of open source tools, such as the Covid-19 Vulnerability Index, to help operational decision making in the charity and the broader voluntary and community sector. Mike is also the author of several R packages, including geographr and mortyr. In his spare time you can find him mountain biking and rock climbing around the Alps.
**More:**

* [https://www.mikejohnpage.com/](https://www.mikejohnpage.com/)
* [https://github.com/humaniverse](https://github.com/humaniverse)

**Event details:**
18:00 BelgradeR :: Mike Page, Make you code more shareable, reusable and reproducible with R packages
Tuesday, 28 March
Google Meet joining info
Video call link: https://meet.google.com/qok-jrpw-bwv
